alert.note: Alert for Cass; Ransom; Richland; Sargent (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued June 18 at 2:54PM CDT until June 18 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CDT SUNDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 106 expected. For the Wind Advisory, southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 92 expected. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Wilkin County. In North Dakota, Cass, Ransom, Sargent and Richland Counties. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 10 AM to 9 PM CDT Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Heat Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 10 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. A few power outages are possible. Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
